page.title: 04Land use/soil
page.content: The underlying rock of the whole area is clay of one type or another except by the Fairham Brook which is river- ine alluvium. Towards the W and NW is grade 2 land, coarse loamy over clayey which has minor limitations that re- duce the range of suitable crops or interfere with cultivation (about 15% of the block). The land either side of Fairham Brook is grade 4, waterlogged blue-grey clay soil and liable to flooding. Most of the block (75%) is grade 3 land; around Wysall the under- lying rock is mixed chalky and reddish boulder clay which gives a loamy and clayey soil, with a similar soil type around Widmerpool. The area between is chiefly clayey and demands careful management. There are no large woods but several plantations of mixed trees totalling 5% of the area. The rest of the block (3%) is residential.
